Operation 'VerifySenderToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. The original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). The description lacks critical details: it doesn't explain what happens when verification succeeds (side effect: sender becomes verified), doesn't specify the return value, doesn't clarify that this completes the verification workflow, and doesn't explain the token's origin clearly. The phrase 'verify a sender requests' contains a grammatical error. The improved version uses domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity'), explains the workflow context, specifies the action's effect on the sender's status, clarifies inputs and outputs, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (when they have a verification token and need to complete sender verification).

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to verify a sender requests.**

The token is generated by SendGrid and included in a verification email delivered to the address that's pending verification.
data.summary_suggestion: Verify a sender identity using token
data.description_suggestion: Completes the sender identity verification process by validating the verification token sent to the pending sender's email address. The token is generated by SendGrid and included in the verification email. This operation marks the sender identity as verified upon successful token validation, enabling the sender to send emails through your account. Returns the verified sender identity details. Requires the valid verification token as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). The description lacks critical details: it doesn't explain what happens when verification succeeds (side effect: sender becomes verified), doesn't specify the return value, doesn't clarify that this completes the verification workflow, and doesn't explain the token's origin clearly. The phrase 'verify a sender requests' contains a grammatical error. The improved version uses domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity'), explains the workflow context, specifies the action's effect on the sender's status, clarifies inputs and outputs, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (when they have a verification token and need to complete sender verification).

message: Operation 'CreateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action. Description lacks explicit information about what is returned (the created Sender Identity object with ID). Added clarity about required inputs, the verification workflow, and return value to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new Sender Identify**.

Upon successful submission of a `POST` request to this endpoint, an identity will be created, and a verification email will be sent to the address assigned to the `from_email` field. You must complete the verification process using the sent email to fully verify the sender.

If you need to resend the verification email, you can do so with the Resend Verified Sender Request, `/resend/{id}`, endpoint.

If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the [Domain Authentication API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/domain-authentication/authenticate-a-domain).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Sender Identity for your account. Requires the sender's email address and other identity details in the request body. Upon successful creation, a verification email is sent to the specified `from_email` address. The sender must complete email verification to activate the identity. Returns the created Sender Identity object with a unique ID. Note: Use the Resend Verified Sender endpoint to resend verification emails if needed.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action. Description lacks explicit information about what is returned (the created Sender Identity object with ID). Added clarity about required inputs, the verification workflow, and return value to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'UpdateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is vague and doesn't use domain terminology consistent with the API (which uses 'Sender Identity'). Description lacks explicit information about the return value. Enhanced summary to use 'Update' and 'Sender Identity' terminology, and added clarity about the returned object for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an existing Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint as a path parameter. Include any fields you wish to update in the request body in JSON format.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a `GET` request to the Get All Verified Senders endpoint, `/verified_senders`.

**Note:** Unlike a `PUT` request, `PATCH` allows you to update only the fields you wish to edit. Fields that are not passed as part of a request will remain unaltered.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing Sender Identity using partial updates. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter and the fields to update in the request body. Supports partial updatesonly provided fields are modified; unspecified fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated Sender Identity object. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is vague and doesn't use domain terminology consistent with the API (which uses 'Sender Identity'). Description lacks explicit information about the return value. Enhanced summary to use 'Update' and 'Sender Identity' terminology, and added clarity about the returned object for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and action-oriented. However, description lacks information about the side effects (permanent removal, inability to send emails) and the response format (204 No Content). Added details about the permanent nature of deletion and expected response to improve AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint to delete the Sender Identity from your account.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities using the "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a Sender Identity from your account. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. Upon successful deletion, the Sender Identity is permanently removed and can no longer be used to send emails. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. However, description lacks information about the side effects (permanent removal, inability to send emails) and the response format (204 No Content). Added details about the permanent nature of deletion and expected response to improve AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderDomain' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology. Summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the operation's purpose or action. Terminology is inconsistent with the API context (should reference DMARC and Sender Identity). Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Improved description to clarify the practical implications for Sender Identity creation and better explain the categorization for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint returns a list of domains known to implement DMARC and categorizes them by failure type  hard failure or soft failure**.

Domains listed as hard failures will not deliver mail when used as a [Sender Identity](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/) due to the domain's DMARC policy settings.

For example, using a `yahoo.com` email address as a Sender Identity will likely result in the rejection of your mail. For more information about DMARC, see [Everything about DMARC](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/dmarc/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of domains known to implement DMARC policies, categorized by failure type: hard failures (mail delivery will be rejected) and soft failures (mail delivery may be rejected). Hard failure domains cannot be used as Sender Identities. Returns domain categorization to help identify problematic sender domains. For example, yahoo.com is a hard failure domain. Useful for validating Sender Identity domains before creation.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the operation's purpose or action. Terminology is inconsistent with the API context (should reference DMARC and Sender Identity). Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Improved description to clarify the practical implications for Sender Identity creation and better explain the categorization for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ResendVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action (resending verification email). Description lacks explicit information about the response/return value. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific. Added clarity about the return value and improved phrasing for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to resend a verification email to a specified Sender Identity**.

Passing the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint will resend a verification email to the `from_address` associated with the Sender Identity. This can be useful if someone loses their verification email or needs to have it resent for any other reason.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Resend verification email to Sender Identity
data.description_suggestion: Resends a verification email to an unverified Sender Identity. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. The verification email is sent to the email address associated with the Sender Identity. Useful when the original verification email is lost or needs to be resent. Returns a success response upon sending. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action (resending verification email). Description lacks explicit information about the response/return value. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific. Added clarity about the return value and improved phrasing for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderStepsCompleted' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Summary 'Completed Steps' is too vague and doesn't clearly indicate what steps or what the operation does. Description is unclear about what specific information is returned and when an AI agent should use this operation. Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Clarified the return values and added context about practical use cases for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to determine which of SendGrid's verification processes have been completed for an account**.

This endpoint returns boolean values, `true` and `false`, for [Domain Authentication](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#domain-authentication), `domain_verified`, and [Single Sender Verification](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#single-sender-verification), `sender_verified`, for the account.

An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the verification status of your account's sender authentication methods. Returns boolean flags indicating completion status: `domain_verified` (Domain Authentication) and `sender_verified` (Single Sender Verification). An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. Useful for determining which sender authentication methods are active before creating new Sender Identities.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Completed Steps' is too vague and doesn't clearly indicate what steps or what the operation does. Description is unclear about what specific information is returned and when an AI agent should use this operation. Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Clarified the return values and added context about practical use cases for better AI agent interpretability.

Operation 'VerifySenderToken' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. The original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). The description lacks critical details: it doesn't explain what happens when verification succeeds (side effect: sender becomes verified), doesn't specify the return value, doesn't clarify that this completes the verification workflow, and doesn't explain the token's origin clearly. The phrase 'verify a sender requests' contains a grammatical error. The improved version uses domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity'), explains the workflow context, specifies the action's effect on the sender's status, clarifies inputs and outputs, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (when they have a verification token and need to complete sender verification).

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to verify a sender requests.**

The token is generated by SendGrid and included in a verification email delivered to the address that's pending verification.
data.summary_suggestion: Verify a sender identity using token
data.description_suggestion: Completes the sender identity verification process by validating the verification token sent to the pending sender's email address. The token is generated by SendGrid and included in the verification email. This operation marks the sender identity as verified upon successful token validation, enabling the sender to send emails through your account. Returns the verified sender identity details. Requires the valid verification token as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Verify Sender Request' is vague and uses imprecise terminology ('Request' vs 'Identity'). The description lacks critical details: it doesn't explain what happens when verification succeeds (side effect: sender becomes verified), doesn't specify the return value, doesn't clarify that this completes the verification workflow, and doesn't explain the token's origin clearly. The phrase 'verify a sender requests' contains a grammatical error. The improved version uses domain-appropriate terminology ('sender identity'), explains the workflow context, specifies the action's effect on the sender's status, clarifies inputs and outputs, and helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (when they have a verification token and need to complete sender verification).

message: Operation 'CreateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action. Description lacks explicit information about what is returned (the created Sender Identity object with ID). Added clarity about required inputs, the verification workflow, and return value to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new Sender Identify**.

Upon successful submission of a `POST` request to this endpoint, an identity will be created, and a verification email will be sent to the address assigned to the `from_email` field. You must complete the verification process using the sent email to fully verify the sender.

If you need to resend the verification email, you can do so with the Resend Verified Sender Request, `/resend/{id}`, endpoint.

If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the [Domain Authentication API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/domain-authentication/authenticate-a-domain).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Sender Identity for your account. Requires the sender's email address and other identity details in the request body. Upon successful creation, a verification email is sent to the specified `from_email` address. The sender must complete email verification to activate the identity. Returns the created Sender Identity object with a unique ID. Note: Use the Resend Verified Sender endpoint to resend verification emails if needed.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action. Description lacks explicit information about what is returned (the created Sender Identity object with ID). Added clarity about required inputs, the verification workflow, and return value to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'UpdateVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is vague and doesn't use domain terminology consistent with the API (which uses 'Sender Identity'). Description lacks explicit information about the return value. Enhanced summary to use 'Update' and 'Sender Identity' terminology, and added clarity about the returned object for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update an existing Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint as a path parameter. Include any fields you wish to update in the request body in JSON format.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a `GET` request to the Get All Verified Senders endpoint, `/verified_senders`.

**Note:** Unlike a `PUT` request, `PATCH` allows you to update only the fields you wish to edit. Fields that are not passed as part of a request will remain unaltered.
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing Sender Identity using partial updates. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter and the fields to update in the request body. Supports partial updatesonly provided fields are modified; unspecified fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated Sender Identity object. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Edit Verified Sender' is vague and doesn't use domain terminology consistent with the API (which uses 'Sender Identity'). Description lacks explicit information about the return value. Enhanced summary to use 'Update' and 'Sender Identity' terminology, and added clarity about the returned object for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and action-oriented. However, description lacks information about the side effects (permanent removal, inability to send emails) and the response format (204 No Content). Added details about the permanent nature of deletion and expected response to improve AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a Sender Identity**.

Pass the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint to delete the Sender Identity from your account.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities using the "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a Sender Identity from your account. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. Upon successful deletion, the Sender Identity is permanently removed and can no longer be used to send emails. Returns a 204 No Content response on success. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. However, description lacks information about the side effects (permanent removal, inability to send emails) and the response format (204 No Content). Added details about the permanent nature of deletion and expected response to improve AI agent understanding of operation consequences.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderDomain' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology. Summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the operation's purpose or action. Terminology is inconsistent with the API context (should reference DMARC and Sender Identity). Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Improved description to clarify the practical implications for Sender Identity creation and better explain the categorization for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint returns a list of domains known to implement DMARC and categorizes them by failure type  hard failure or soft failure**.

Domains listed as hard failures will not deliver mail when used as a [Sender Identity](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/) due to the domain's DMARC policy settings.

For example, using a `yahoo.com` email address as a Sender Identity will likely result in the rejection of your mail. For more information about DMARC, see [Everything about DMARC](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/dmarc/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of domains known to implement DMARC policies, categorized by failure type: hard failures (mail delivery will be rejected) and soft failures (mail delivery may be rejected). Hard failure domains cannot be used as Sender Identities. Returns domain categorization to help identify problematic sender domains. For example, yahoo.com is a hard failure domain. Useful for validating Sender Identity domains before creation.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Domain Warn List' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the operation's purpose or action. Terminology is inconsistent with the API context (should reference DMARC and Sender Identity). Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Improved description to clarify the practical implications for Sender Identity creation and better explain the categorization for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ResendVerifiedSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action (resending verification email). Description lacks explicit information about the response/return value. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific. Added clarity about the return value and improved phrasing for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to resend a verification email to a specified Sender Identity**.

Passing the `id` assigned to a Sender Identity to this endpoint will resend a verification email to the `from_address` associated with the Sender Identity. This can be useful if someone loses their verification email or needs to have it resent for any other reason.

You can retrieve the IDs associated with Sender Identities by passing a "Get All Verified Senders" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Resend verification email to Sender Identity
data.description_suggestion: Resends a verification email to an unverified Sender Identity. Requires the Sender Identity ID as a path parameter. The verification email is sent to the email address associated with the Sender Identity. Useful when the original verification email is lost or needs to be resent. Returns a success response upon sending. Retrieve Sender Identity IDs using the List Verified Senders endpoint.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Resend Verified Sender Request' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate the action (resending verification email). Description lacks explicit information about the response/return value. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific. Added clarity about the return value and improved phrasing for better AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'ListVerifiedSenderStepsCompleted' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Summary 'Completed Steps' is too vague and doesn't clearly indicate what steps or what the operation does. Description is unclear about what specific information is returned and when an AI agent should use this operation. Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Clarified the return values and added context about practical use cases for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to determine which of SendGrid's verification processes have been completed for an account**.

This endpoint returns boolean values, `true` and `false`, for [Domain Authentication](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#domain-authentication), `domain_verified`, and [Single Sender Verification](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/sender-identity/#single-sender-verification), `sender_verified`, for the account.

An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. If you need to authenticate a domain rather than a Single Sender, see the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the verification status of your account's sender authentication methods. Returns boolean flags indicating completion status: `domain_verified` (Domain Authentication) and `sender_verified` (Single Sender Verification). An account may have one, both, or neither verification steps completed. Useful for determining which sender authentication methods are active before creating new Sender Identities.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Completed Steps' is too vague and doesn't clearly indicate what steps or what the operation does. Description is unclear about what specific information is returned and when an AI agent should use this operation. Enhanced summary to be more descriptive and action-oriented. Clarified the return values and added context about practical use cases for better AI agent interpretability.
